elements.content: A microporous metal–organic framework [Cu2L­(H2O)2]­·(DMF)0.5­·(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, H4TTCA-NH2 = 5-amino-3,3,5,5-tetracarboxylic acid, DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been designed, synthesized, structurally characterized, and examined for its gas storage and separation. The activated ZJU-195a has achieved high C2H2 storages of 275.6 cm3·g–1 at 273 K and 214.2 cm3·g–1 at 298 K under 1.0 bar. Furthermore, ZJU-195a selectively adsorbs C2H2 over CO2 and CH4, exhibiting moderately high C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 separations at ambient conditions with an ideal adsorbed solution theory selectivity of 43.4–64.6 and 4.7–12.4, respectively.
elements.clean_text: A microporous metal-organic framework [Cu2L(H2O)2]⋅(DMF)0.5⋅(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, H4TTCA-NH2 = 5-amino-3,3,5,5-tetracarboxylic acid, DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been designed, synthesized, structurally characterized, and examined for its gas storage and separation. The activated ZJU-195a has achieved high C2H2 storages of 275.6 cm3⋅g-1 at 273 K and 214.2 cm3⋅g-1 at 298 K under 1.0 bar. Furthermore, ZJU-195a selectively adsorbs C2H2 over CO2 and CH4, exhibiting moderately high C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 separations at ambient conditions with an ideal adsorbed solution theory selectivity of 43.4-64.6 and 4.7-12.4, respectively.

elements.content: A microporous metal−organic framework [Cu2L­(H2O)2]­·(DMF)0.5­·(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, H4TTCA-NH2 = 5-amino-3,3,5,5-tetracarboxylic acid, DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been designed, synthesized, structurally characterized, and examined for its gas storage and separation.

elements.content:
Published as part of a Crystal Growth and Design virtual special issue on Crystal Engineering of Nanoporous Materials for Gas Storage and Separation

Crude oil, also named “black gold” and “the blood of modern industry”, with alkanes and alkynes as the main components, has been playing a crucial part in the national economy. As one of the widely used raw chemicals, acetylene (C2H2), mainly produced by the cracking of petroleum, generally contains some other spin-offs, such as carbon dioxide and methane. High-efficiency separation of C2H2 from CO2 and CH4 are of significance in improving the efficiency of acetylene.
elements.clean_text:
Published as part of a Crystal Growth and Design virtual special issue on Crystal Engineering of Nanoporous Materials for Gas Storage and Separation

Crude oil, also named "black gold" and "the blood of modern industry", with alkanes and alkynes as the main components, has been playing a crucial part in the national economy. As one of the widely used raw chemicals, acetylene (C2H2), mainly produced by the cracking of petroleum, generally contains some other spin-offs, such as carbon dioxide and methane. High-efficiency separation of C2H2 from CO2 and CH4 are of significance in improving the efficiency of acetylene.

elements.content: The traditional approaches for the separation of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 are of high energy consumption and poor efficiency; thus some alternative technologies and materials need to be developed. Among the diverse materials, metal–organic frameworks (MOFs) are of particularly interest for such demands.
elements.clean_text: The traditional approaches for the separation of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 are of high energy consumption and poor efficiency; thus some alternative technologies and materials need to be developed. Among the diverse materials, metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) are of particularly interest for such demands.

elements.content: Nowadays, a great number of MOFs have been already explored for the separation of the relatively distinct C2H2 and CH4, while the achievement of efficient separation of C2H2 from CO2 is still challenging because of their comparable dynamic sizes and boiling points. To date, only a few MOFs have been designed and characterized as successful examples with high C2H2/CO2 selectivity and high C2H2 storage capacity simultaneously. For instance, HKUST-1 has exhibited high C2H2 uptake (201 cm3·g–1) but relatively low C2H2/CO2 selectivity (5.8) due to a lack of strong selective sites. On the contrary, UTSA-50 has achieved a slightly higher C2H2/CO2 selectivity for the existence of Lewis basic sites (LBSs) and open metal sites (OMSs) but limited C2H2 storage capacity (91 cm3·g–1). Obviously, it is still quite challenging for MOFs to have both high C2H2/CO2 selectivity and acetylene uptake capacity simultaneously.
elements.clean_text: Nowadays, a great number of MOFs have been already explored for the separation of the relatively distinct C2H2 and CH4, while the achievement of efficient separation of C2H2 from CO2 is still challenging because of their comparable dynamic sizes and boiling points. To date, only a few MOFs have been designed and characterized as successful examples with high C2H2/CO2 selectivity and high C2H2 storage capacity simultaneously. For instance, HKUST-1 has exhibited high C2H2 uptake (201 cm3⋅g-1) but relatively low C2H2/CO2 selectivity (5.8) due to a lack of strong selective sites. On the contrary, UTSA-50 has achieved a slightly higher C2H2/CO2 selectivity for the existence of Lewis basic sites (LBSs) and open metal sites (OMSs) but limited C2H2 storage capacity (91 cm3⋅g-1). Obviously, it is still quite challenging for MOFs to have both high C2H2/CO2 selectivity and acetylene uptake capacity simultaneously.

elements.content: The introduction of the polarized functional group into the high-porosity framework is very likely to address the aforementioned worrisome issue. Herein, we have developed a new tetracarboxylic acid ligand with an exposed amino functional group H4TTCA-NH2 () and thus synthesized its first Cu-based MOF [Cu2L­(H2O)2]·(DMF)0.5·(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, ZJU = Zhejiang University). Accordingly, the activated ZJU-195a has turned in a decent performance at the C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 separation exhibiting quite high C2H2 storages (275.6 cm3·g–1 for 273 K and 214.2 cm3·g–1 for 298 K under 1.0 bar) and excellent C2H2/CH4 (28.2–86.3 for 273 K, 43.4–64.6 for 298 K) and C2H2/CO2 (4.7–15.5 for 273 K, 4.7–12.4 298 K) selectivity, further featuring ZJU-195a as a potential material for gas storage and separation.
elements.clean_text: The introduction of the polarized functional group into the high-porosity framework is very likely to address the aforementioned worrisome issue. Herein, we have developed a new tetracarboxylic acid ligand with an exposed amino functional group H4TTCA-NH2 () and thus synthesized its first Cu-based MOF [Cu2L(H2O)2]⋅(DMF)0.5⋅(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, ZJU = Zhejiang University). Accordingly, the activated ZJU-195a has turned in a decent performance at the C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 separation exhibiting quite high C2H2 storages (275.6 cm3⋅g-1 for 273 K and 214.2 cm3⋅g-1 for 298 K under 1.0 bar) and excellent C2H2/CH4 (28.2-86.3 for 273 K, 43.4-64.6 for 298 K) and C2H2/CO2 (4.7-15.5 for 273 K, 4.7-12.4 298 K) selectivity, further featuring ZJU-195a as a potential material for gas storage and separation.

elements.clean_text: 1  Organic Linker H4TTCA-NH2 Used to Construct ZJU-195

elements.content: Results and Discussion. The tetracarboxylic acid, H4TTCA-NH2, was successfully synthesized based on the Suzuki cross-coupling reaction (Figure S1). The solvothermal reaction of H4TTCA-NH2 and Cu­(NO3)2­·2.5H2O yielded glaucous block crystals ZJU-195, which has a formula of [Cu2L­(H2O)2]­·(DMF)0.5­·(H2O)7 determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction and elemental analysis (EA). The purity of phase was further indicated by powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD).
elements.clean_text: Results and Discussion. The tetracarboxylic acid, H4TTCA-NH2, was successfully synthesized based on the Suzuki cross-coupling reaction (Figure S1). The solvothermal reaction of H4TTCA-NH2 and Cu(NO3)2⋅2.5H2O yielded glaucous block crystals ZJU-195, which has a formula of [Cu2L(H2O)2]⋅(DMF)0.5⋅(H2O)7 determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction and elemental analysis (EA). The purity of phase was further indicated by powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD).

elements.content: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data of ZJU-195 indicated that ZJU-195 crystallizes in the Cmcm space group with a crystal system of orthorhombic, with unit cell parameters of a = 24.8 Å, b = 33.6 Å, c = 18.7 Å, and a cell volume of 15533.6 Å3. As is shown in a, the classical paddle-wheel dinuclear Cu2(COO)4 as the four-coordination secondary building units (SBUs) assembles with the same four-coordination linkers H4TTCA-NH2 to form a three-dimensional (3D) framework. ZJU-195 features two different types of cages. Thirteen organic linkers and 11 SBUs constructs the larger cage with a diameter of approximately of 9.5 Å (c), while the smaller cage of about 6.5 Å (d) is surrounded by 9 ligands and 8 SBUs. The pore channels of the 3D framework are 5.6 Å × 8.2 Å, 4.4 Å × 4.4 and 6.4 Å × 8.9 Å viewed from a, b, and c axes successively (e,f,b). The van der Waals radii of atoms have been already taken into account when labeling the size of cages and channels. It is worth noting that there are large amounts of exposed amino functional groups directly located in the c axial positions which will play an important role in further gas storage and separation.
elements.clean_text: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data of ZJU-195 indicated that ZJU-195 crystallizes in the Cmcm space group with a crystal system of orthorhombic, with unit cell parameters of a = 24.8 Å, b = 33.6 Å, c = 18.7 Å, and a cell volume of 15533.6 Å3. As is shown in a, the classical paddle-wheel dinuclear Cu2(COO)4 as the four-coordination secondary building units (SBUs) assembles with the same four-coordination linkers H4TTCA-NH2 to form a three-dimensional (3D) framework. ZJU-195 features two different types of cages. Thirteen organic linkers and 11 SBUs constructs the larger cage with a diameter of approximately of 9.5 Å (c), while the smaller cage of about 6.5 Å (d) is surrounded by 9 ligands and 8 SBUs. The pore channels of the 3D framework are 5.6 Å × 8.2 Å, 4.4 Å × 4.4 and 6.4 Å × 8.9 Å viewed from a, b, and c axes successively (e,f,b). The van der Waals radii of atoms have been already taken into account when labeling the size of cages and channels. It is worth noting that there are large amounts of exposed amino functional groups directly located in the c axial positions which will play an important role in further gas storage and separation.

elements.content: X-ray single crystal structure of ZJU-195 revealing (a) each tetracarboxylic acid ligand connects with four paddle-wheel Cu2(COO)4 clusters; (c, d) two types of cages of ZJU-195; the pore channels of ZJU-195 viewed from the a axis of (e), b axis of (f), and c axis of (b) (C, violet; O, red; N, blue and Cu, azure; H atoms and guest molecules are omitted for clarity).
elements.clean_text: 1  X-ray single crystal structure of ZJU-195 revealing (a) each tetracarboxylic acid ligand connects with four paddle-wheel Cu2(COO)4 clusters; (c, d) two types of cages of ZJU-195; the pore channels of ZJU-195 viewed from the a axis of (e), b axis of (f), and c axis of (b) (C, violet; O, red; N, blue and Cu, azure; H atoms and guest molecules are omitted for clarity).

elements.content: The moderate cages encouraged us to assess the porosity of ZJU-195. After the sufficient acetone exchange, ZJU-195 was evacuated at 273 K for 1 day, 298 K for 12 h, 323 K for 5 h, and 373 K for 2 h successively to yield the activated ZJU-195a. Apparently, the PXRD profile of ZJU-195a is approximately consistent with the simulated one (Figure S4). Thus, the ZJU-195a was followed by the N2 sorption at 77 K. The N2-77 K isotherm of ZJU-195a () takes on classical Type-I sorption behavior, with a saturation uptake of 601.9 cm3·g–1 and a pore volume of 0.93 cm3·g–1. Thus, the corresponding Langmuir surface areas and Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) were estimated to be 1786.9 m2·g–1 and 1721.9 m2·g–1, respectively. Especially, the pore size distribution of ZJU-195a (Figure S5) obtained from the micropore analysis concentrates on 5.0–9.0 Å, quite consistent with the aforementioned pore channels.
elements.clean_text: The moderate cages encouraged us to assess the porosity of ZJU-195. After the sufficient acetone exchange, ZJU-195 was evacuated at 273 K for 1 day, 298 K for 12 h, 323 K for 5 h, and 373 K for 2 h successively to yield the activated ZJU-195a. Apparently, the PXRD profile of ZJU-195a is approximately consistent with the simulated one (Figure S4). Thus, the ZJU-195a was followed by the N2 sorption at 77 K. The N2-77 K isotherm of ZJU-195a () takes on classical Type-I sorption behavior, with a saturation uptake of 601.9 cm3⋅g-1 and a pore volume of 0.93 cm3⋅g-1. Thus, the corresponding Langmuir surface areas and Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) were estimated to be 1786.9 m2⋅g-1 and 1721.9 m2⋅g-1, respectively. Especially, the pore size distribution of ZJU-195a (Figure S5) obtained from the micropore analysis concentrates on 5.0-9.0 Å, quite consistent with the aforementioned pore channels.

elements.content: N2 sorption isotherms of ZJU-195a at 77 K. Closed symbols, adsorption; open symbols, desorption.
elements.clean_text: 2  N2 sorption isotherms of ZJU-195a at 77 K. Closed symbols, adsorption; open symbols, desorption.

elements.content: The performance of ZJU-195a for the C2H2 storage and separations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 has been examined. The low-pressure adsorption of C2H2, CO2 and CH4 was implemented at 273 and 298 K, respectively (). ZJU-195a adsorbs much higher C2H2, but much lower CO2 and CH4 both at 273 and 298 K. At 273 K and 1 atm, the C2H2, CO2 and CH4 uptake capacities of ZJU-195a are 275.6, 169.7, and 45.8 cm3·g–1, respectively (a). The same tendency is also found at 298 K and 1 atm in which the uptake capacities of ZJU-195a are 214.2, 105.0, and 24.5 cm3·g–1 for C2H2, CO2, and CH4, respectively (b). Interestingly, the C2H2 storage capacity of ZJU-195 (214 cm3·g–1) is only slightly lower than that of FJH-H8 (224 cm3·g–1, the record acetylene storage material gravimetrically), but significantly higher than that of ZJU-199 (128 cm3·g–1), and even higher than those of well-known HKUST-1 (201 cm3·g–1) and CoMOF-74 (197 cm3·g–1), demonstrating ZJU-195a as one of the best MOFs for acetylene storage.
elements.clean_text: The performance of ZJU-195a for the C2H2 storage and separations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 has been examined. The low-pressure adsorption of C2H2, CO2 and CH4 was implemented at 273 and 298 K, respectively (). ZJU-195a adsorbs much higher C2H2, but much lower CO2 and CH4 both at 273 and 298 K. At 273 K and 1 atm, the C2H2, CO2 and CH4 uptake capacities of ZJU-195a are 275.6, 169.7, and 45.8 cm3⋅g-1, respectively (a). The same tendency is also found at 298 K and 1 atm in which the uptake capacities of ZJU-195a are 214.2, 105.0, and 24.5 cm3⋅g-1 for C2H2, CO2, and CH4, respectively (b). Interestingly, the C2H2 storage capacity of ZJU-195 (214 cm3⋅g-1) is only slightly lower than that of FJH-H8 (224 cm3⋅g-1, the record acetylene storage material gravimetrically), but significantly higher than that of ZJU-199 (128 cm3⋅g-1), and even higher than those of well-known HKUST-1 (201 cm3⋅g-1) and CoMOF-74 (197 cm3⋅g-1), demonstrating ZJU-195a as one of the best MOFs for acetylene storage.

elements.content: Single-component adsorption isotherms for C2H2 (violet), CO2 (orange), and CH4 (blue) of ZJU-195a at 273 K (a) and 298 K (b), respectively.
elements.clean_text: 3  Single-component adsorption isotherms for C2H2 (violet), CO2 (orange), and CH4 (blue) of ZJU-195a at 273 K (a) and 298 K (b), respectively.

elements.content: In view of the significant difference of the C2H2, CO2, and CH4 adsorption performance of ZJU-195a, we chose the ideal adsorbed solution theory (IAST) recognized to estimate the adsorption selectivity for C2H2/CO2 (50:50, v:v) and C2H2/CH4 (50:50, v:v). Thus, the results of the IAST calculation for C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 at 273 and 298 K were expressed in . It is clear to read that the C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 selectivity coefficients of ZJU-195a are 4.7–15.5 and 28.2–86.3 for 273 K, 43.4–64.6 and 4.7–12.4 for 298 K, respectively. Obviously, the separation performance of ZJU-195a is equal to UTSA-50a, outdistancing immensely ZJU-199a, featuring the bright promise of ZJU-195a for the separations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4.
elements.clean_text: In view of the significant difference of the C2H2, CO2, and CH4 adsorption performance of ZJU-195a, we chose the ideal adsorbed solution theory (IAST) recognized to estimate the adsorption selectivity for C2H2/CO2 (50:50, v:v) and C2H2/CH4 (50:50, v:v). Thus, the results of the IAST calculation for C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 at 273 and 298 K were expressed in . It is clear to read that the C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 selectivity coefficients of ZJU-195a are 4.7-15.5 and 28.2-86.3 for 273 K, 43.4-64.6 and 4.7-12.4 for 298 K, respectively. Obviously, the separation performance of ZJU-195a is equal to UTSA-50a, outdistancing immensely ZJU-199a, featuring the bright promise of ZJU-195a for the separations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4.

elements.content: (a) IAST calculations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 adsorption selectivity for ZJU-195a at 273 K; (b) IAST calculations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 adsorption selectivity for ZJU-195a at 298 K.
elements.clean_text: 4  (a) IAST calculations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 adsorption selectivity for ZJU-195a at 273 K; (b) IAST calculations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 adsorption selectivity for ZJU-195a at 298 K.

elements.content: As is well-known, the binding energy is reflected in the isosteric heat of adsorption (Q st) (). Obviously, the stronger the adsorption, the higher the Q st. Furthermore, the higher the Q st, the larger the regeneration cost. As for ZJU-195a, the isosteric heat of C2H2 is highest for 29.9 kJ·mol–1, followed by CO2 (20.7 kJ·mol–1) and CH4 (19.9 kJ·mol–1). It is worth noting that the value of Q st for C2H2 is much higher than those of CO2 and CH4, indicating the much stronger interaction between C2H2 molecule and framework. It is easy to understand that the exposed amino polarized functional group has made a major preferential selectivity for the linear acidulous C2H2 molecule. What is more, the isosteric heat of C2H2 of ZJU-195a is lower than those of most of MOFs applying for C2H2 storage (32.0 kJ·mol–1 in FJH-H8, 50.0 kJ·mol–1 in CoMOF-74, 34.0 kJ·mol–1 in HKUST-1, 39.4 kJ·mol–1 in UTSA-50, and 38.5 kJ·mol–1 in ZJU-199), indicating the available energy-efficient potential of ZJU-195a.

Furthermore, the higher the Q st, the larger the regeneration cost. As for ZJU-195a, the isosteric heat of C2H2 is highest for 29.9 kJ⋅mol-1, followed by CO2 (20.7 kJ⋅mol-1) and CH4 (19.9 kJ⋅mol-1). It is worth noting that the value of Q st for C2H2 is much higher than those of CO2 and CH4, indicating the much stronger interaction between C2H2 molecule and framework. It is easy to understand that the exposed amino polarized functional group has made a major preferential selectivity for the linear acidulous C2H2 molecule. What is more, the isosteric heat of C2H2 of ZJU-195a is lower than those of most of MOFs applying for C2H2 storage (32.0 kJ⋅mol-1 in FJH-H8, 50.0 kJ⋅mol-1 in CoMOF-74, 34.0 kJ⋅mol-1 in HKUST-1, 39.4 kJ⋅mol-1 in UTSA-50, and 38.5 kJ⋅mol-1 in ZJU-199), indicating the available energy-efficient potential of ZJU-195a.

elements.content: Isosteric heats of C2H2, CO2, and CH4 adsorption, Q st, in ZJU-195a.
elements.clean_text: 5  Isosteric heats of C2H2, CO2, and CH4 adsorption, Q st, in ZJU-195a.

elements.content: In summary, a new tetracarboxlic acid has been designed, and its first MOF ZJU-195 with exposed amino functional group has been successfully synthesized. ZJU-195a has further been verified as one of the best promising MOFs for C2H2 storage, exhibiting ultrahigh C2H2 uptake and excellent C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 separations simultaneously attributed to the introduction of the functional group. Thus, ZJU-195 successfully provides an efficient model to have both high storage capacity and gas selectivity. It is believed that this work will spark a new view of MOFs for gas storage and separation.
elements.clean_text: In summary, a new tetracarboxlic acid has been designed, and its first MOF ZJU-195 with exposed amino functional group has been successfully synthesized. ZJU-195a has further been verified as one of the best promising MOFs for C2H2 storage, exhibiting ultrahigh C2H2 uptake and excellent C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 separations simultaneously attributed to the introduction of the functional group. Thus, ZJU-195 successfully provides an efficient model to have both high storage capacity and gas selectivity. It is believed that this work will spark a new view of MOFs for gas storage and separation.

cln_elements.content:
A microporous metal–organic framework [Cu2L­(H2O)2]­·(DMF)0.5­·(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, H4TTCA-NH2 = 5-amino-3,3,5,5-tetracarboxylic acid, DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been designed, synthesized, structurally characterized, and examined for its gas storage and separation. The activated ZJU-195a has achieved high C2H2 storages of 275.6 cm3·g–1 at 273 K and 214.2 cm3·g–1 at 298 K under 1.0 bar. Furthermore, ZJU-195a selectively adsorbs C2H2 over CO2 and CH4, exhibiting moderately high C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 separations at ambient conditions with an ideal adsorbed solution theory selectivity of 43.4–64.6 and 4.7–12.4, respectively.

The introduction of the polarized functional group into the high-porosity framework is very likely to address the aforementioned worrisome issue. Herein, we have developed a new tetracarboxylic acid ligand with an exposed amino functional group H4TTCA-NH2 () and thus synthesized its first Cu-based MOF [Cu2L­(H2O)2]·(DMF)0.5·(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, ZJU = Zhejiang University). Accordingly, the activated ZJU-195a has turned in a decent performance at the C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 separation exhibiting quite high C2H2 storages (275.6 cm3·g–1 for 273 K and 214.2 cm3·g–1 for 298 K under 1.0 bar) and excellent C2H2/CH4 (28.2–86.3 for 273 K, 43.4–64.6 for 298 K) and C2H2/CO2 (4.7–15.5 for 273 K, 4.7–12.4 298 K) selectivity, further featuring ZJU-195a as a potential material for gas storage and separation.

Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data of ZJU-195 indicated that ZJU-195 crystallizes in the Cmcm space group with a crystal system of orthorhombic, with unit cell parameters of a = 24.8 Å, b = 33.6 Å, c = 18.7 Å, and a cell volume of 15533.6 Å3. As is shown in a, the classical paddle-wheel dinuclear Cu2(COO)4 as the four-coordination secondary building units (SBUs) assembles with the same four-coordination linkers H4TTCA-NH2 to form a three-dimensional (3D) framework. ZJU-195 features two different types of cages. Thirteen organic linkers and 11 SBUs constructs the larger cage with a diameter of approximately of 9.5 Å (c), while the smaller cage of about 6.5 Å (d) is surrounded by 9 ligands and 8 SBUs. The pore channels of the 3D framework are 5.6 Å × 8.2 Å, 4.4 Å × 4.4 and 6.4 Å × 8.9 Å viewed from a, b, and c axes successively (e,f,b). The van der Waals radii of atoms have been already taken into account when labeling the size of cages and channels. It is worth noting that there are large amounts of exposed amino functional groups directly located in the c axial positions which will play an important role in further gas storage and separation.

The moderate cages encouraged us to assess the porosity of ZJU-195. After the sufficient acetone exchange, ZJU-195 was evacuated at 273 K for 1 day, 298 K for 12 h, 323 K for 5 h, and 373 K for 2 h successively to yield the activated ZJU-195a. Apparently, the PXRD profile of ZJU-195a is approximately consistent with the simulated one (Figure S4). Thus, the ZJU-195a was followed by the N2 sorption at 77 K. The N2-77 K isotherm of ZJU-195a () takes on classical Type-I sorption behavior, with a saturation uptake of 601.9 cm3·g–1 and a pore volume of 0.93 cm3·g–1. Thus, the corresponding Langmuir surface areas and Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) were estimated to be 1786.9 m2·g–1 and 1721.9 m2·g–1, respectively. Especially, the pore size distribution of ZJU-195a (Figure S5) obtained from the micropore analysis concentrates on 5.0–9.0 Å, quite consistent with the aforementioned pore channels.
cln_elements.clean_text:
A microporous metal-organic framework [Cu2L(H2O)2]⋅(DMF)0.5⋅(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, H4TTCA-NH2 = 5-amino-3,3,5,5-tetracarboxylic acid, DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been designed, synthesized, structurally characterized, and examined for its gas storage and separation. The activated ZJU-195a has achieved high C2H2 storages of 275.6 cm3⋅g-1 at 273 K and 214.2 cm3⋅g-1 at 298 K under 1.0 bar. Furthermore, ZJU-195a selectively adsorbs C2H2 over CO2 and CH4, exhibiting moderately high C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 separations at ambient conditions with an ideal adsorbed solution theory selectivity of 43.4-64.6 and 4.7-12.4, respectively.

The introduction of the polarized functional group into the high-porosity framework is very likely to address the aforementioned worrisome issue. Herein, we have developed a new tetracarboxylic acid ligand with an exposed amino functional group H4TTCA-NH2 () and thus synthesized its first Cu-based MOF [Cu2L(H2O)2]⋅(DMF)0.5⋅(H2O)7, (ZJU-195, ZJU = Zhejiang University). Accordingly, the activated ZJU-195a has turned in a decent performance at the C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 separation exhibiting quite high C2H2 storages (275.6 cm3⋅g-1 for 273 K and 214.2 cm3⋅g-1 for 298 K under 1.0 bar) and excellent C2H2/CH4 (28.2-86.3 for 273 K, 43.4-64.6 for 298 K) and C2H2/CO2 (4.7-15.5 for 273 K, 4.7-12.4 298 K) selectivity, further featuring ZJU-195a as a potential material for gas storage and separation.

Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data of ZJU-195 indicated that ZJU-195 crystallizes in the Cmcm space group with a crystal system of orthorhombic, with unit cell parameters of a = 24.8 Å, b = 33.6 Å, c = 18.7 Å, and a cell volume of 15533.6 Å3. As is shown in a, the classical paddle-wheel dinuclear Cu2(COO)4 as the four-coordination secondary building units (SBUs) assembles with the same four-coordination linkers H4TTCA-NH2 to form a three-dimensional (3D) framework. ZJU-195 features two different types of cages. Thirteen organic linkers and 11 SBUs constructs the larger cage with a diameter of approximately of 9.5 Å (c), while the smaller cage of about 6.5 Å (d) is surrounded by 9 ligands and 8 SBUs. The pore channels of the 3D framework are 5.6 Å × 8.2 Å, 4.4 Å × 4.4 and 6.4 Å × 8.9 Å viewed from a, b, and c axes successively (e,f,b). The van der Waals radii of atoms have been already taken into account when labeling the size of cages and channels. It is worth noting that there are large amounts of exposed amino functional groups directly located in the c axial positions which will play an important role in further gas storage and separation.

The moderate cages encouraged us to assess the porosity of ZJU-195. After the sufficient acetone exchange, ZJU-195 was evacuated at 273 K for 1 day, 298 K for 12 h, 323 K for 5 h, and 373 K for 2 h successively to yield the activated ZJU-195a. Apparently, the PXRD profile of ZJU-195a is approximately consistent with the simulated one (Figure S4). Thus, the ZJU-195a was followed by the N2 sorption at 77 K. The N2-77 K isotherm of ZJU-195a () takes on classical Type-I sorption behavior, with a saturation uptake of 601.9 cm3⋅g-1 and a pore volume of 0.93 cm3⋅g-1. Thus, the corresponding Langmuir surface areas and Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) were estimated to be 1786.9 m2⋅g-1 and 1721.9 m2⋅g-1, respectively. Especially, the pore size distribution of ZJU-195a (Figure S5) obtained from the micropore analysis concentrates on 5.0-9.0 Å, quite consistent with the aforementioned pore channels.

metadata.title:
Microporous Metal–Organic Framework with Exposed
Amino Functional Group for High Acetylene Storage and Excellent C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 Separations
